cs301.group8.database
Class AppDatabase

java.lang.Object
  cs301.group8.database.AppDatabase

public class AppDatabase
extends java.lang.Object

AppDatabase uses SQLite database to create a table where we store our app information. This class provides a variety of methods which allow the application to create, add to, delete, and modify elements corresponding to different pictures,groups, and tags. Each row in the picture table (PICTURETABLE) represents a unique image. The picture table contains 4 columns to describe each picture: group, path, note associated with the photo, and time that the picture was taken. The group table (GROUPTABLE) corresponds to the existing groups and their reminder times The tag table (TAGTABLE) corresponds to the existing tags that are associated with each group

Version:
2.0
Author:
Group 08

AppDatabase

public AppDatabase(Context ctx)
AppDatabase constructor uses the current context of the application (to avoid duplicating or losing data) to create the database object.

Method Detail

getGroups

public java.util.ArrayList<java.lang.String> getGroups()
getGroups queries the database and uses the database cursor to return an array of strings which corresponds to all existing names of groups.

Returns:
groups Array of strings representing the existing groups

getPictures

public java.util.ArrayList<Picture> getPictures(java.lang.String groupName)
getPictures queries the database and uses the database cursor to return an array of picture objects which consists of all pictures that have been added so far that match the group name parameter.

Parameters:
groupName - String of the group name of the specific blemish
Returns:
pics Array of picture objects pertaining to that group

deleteGroup

public void deleteGroup(java.lang.String groupName)
deleteGroup takes in a string of the group name and uses the database helper to query the database for matching group names. The database will delete all entries (including pictures) associated with that group name.

Parameters:
groupName - String of the group name of the specific blemish

deletePicture

public void deletePicture(Picture pic)
                   throws java.lang.Exception
deletePicture takes in a picture object and uses the path of the picture to query the database for the matching entry. The database will remove this entry from the table.

Parameters:
pic - Picture object that is to be deleted from the table
Throws:
java.lang.Exception - Thrown if the picture is not present in the table

addGroup

public void addGroup(java.lang.String groupName)
addGroup method takes a string input and calls the addValues method to add an entry to the picture table. It also sets the default value of reminder to 0 in the reminder table (this will be changed later if necessary).

Parameters:
groupName - String of the group name of the specific blemish

renameGroup

public void renameGroup(java.lang.String oldGroup,
                        java.lang.String newGroup)
renameGroup method takes in 2 strings pertaining to the old group name and new group name. This method queries the database tables and replaces the group names where appropriate (in the GROUPTABLE and PICTURETABLE) renameGroup must also change all the file paths of the old pictures to their appropriate new paths

Parameters:
oldGroup -
newGroup -

addPicture

public void addPicture(Picture pic)
addPicture method takes in a picture object and calls the addValues method on the object's group, and time of creation

Parameters:
pic - Created picture object

addValues

private void addValues(java.lang.String name,
                       long time)
addValues method takes in a string, time, and path corresponding to a picture object. addValues uses each of these values to fill the appropriate columns for the new entry. The values are first inserted into a ContentValues object and added to the PICTURETABLE with the db.insert call.

Parameters:
name - Taken from the picture object: string name of the blemish group
time - Taken from the picture object: long time of creation

groupExists

public boolean groupExists(java.lang.String groupName)
groupExists takes in a string of the group name and returns a boolean value indicating whether the group name exists in the table or not.

Parameters:
groupName - String representing the name of the blemish group
Returns:
boolean Returns true if the group exists in the table. False otherwise

pictureExists

public boolean pictureExists(Picture pic)
                      throws java.lang.Exception
pictureExists takes in a picture object and returns a boolean value indicating whether the picture exists in the table or not.

Parameters:
pic - Picture object
Returns:
boolean Returns true if the picture exists in the table. False otherwise
Throws:
java.lang.Exception - Exception thrown if picture does not exist in the table

close

public void close()
Closes the database upon clean exiting.

addNote

public void addNote(long pid,
                    java.lang.String note)
addNote method takes in a unique picture ID and a string value of the desired note to add. The method uses the path to find a specific photo, and then adds the string note to the NOTE column of the PICTURETABLE

Parameters:
pid - long value corresponding to the picture ID
note - String note to accompany the photo

getNotes

public java.lang.String getNotes(Picture pic)
getNotes queries the database for the specified photo using the picture object. getNotes will return the string value of the note stored in the NOTE column of the database.

Parameters:
pic - Picture object
Returns:
note String value of the note associated with the photo

getPicCount

public long getPicCount(java.lang.String group)
getPicCount takes in a string value of the group name, and returns the number of pictures associated with that group in PICTURETABLE

Parameters:
group - String value of the group name
Returns:
long value of the number of pics

setReminder

public void setReminder(java.lang.String group,
                        long time)
setReminder takes in a string value of the group name and a long value of the reminder time. setReminder puts the value of the reminder into the REMINDER column of the GROUPTABLE. This long value will correspond to the maximum amount of time between the user's current time and the time the most recent picture was taken. If this exceeds the reminder time, the user should be notified.

Parameters:
group - String group name associated with the reminder
time - Long time value (in milliseconds) of reminder

getMostRecent

public long getMostRecent(java.lang.String group)
getMostRecent takes in a string value of the group name and returns the long value of the time the most recent picture was taken. It uses a database query to get all the pictures in the group, and uses the getTime function to return the milliseconds long time that the last picture in the list (most recent) was taken

Parameters:
group - string value of the group name
Returns:
pictime long value of the millisecond time of the most recent picture

updateGroup

public void updateGroup(java.lang.String group,
                        java.lang.String newName,
                        long time)
updateGroup takes in the string value of the group name, the string value of the new name, and the long value of the time. This is called when the user calls the Edit Group dialog in BlemishActivity and enters new values to update the database. We rename the groups (if necessary) and change the reminder times(if necessary) inside the GROUPTABLE and PICTURETABLE.

Parameters:
group - String value of the old group name
newName - String value of the new group name
time - Long value of the reminder time

getReminder

public long getReminder(java.lang.String group)
getReminder queries the GROUPTABLE based on the group name parameter and returns a long value of the reminder time.

Parameters:
group - String value of the group name
Returns:
long Long value of the reminder time (in milliseconds)

setTags

public void setTags(long pid,
                    java.lang.String[] tags)
setTags takes in an array of strings corresponding to the tags input by the user. The tags are stored in the TAGTABLE and correspond to a unique picture object specified by the pid parameter

Parameters:
pid - long value of the picture ID
tags - String array of tags to add to the database

getTags

public java.util.ArrayList<java.lang.String> getTags(long pid)
getTags takes in a long value of the picture ID and returns an ArrayList of strings that have been stored with that picture.

Parameters:
pid - Long value of the unique picture ID
Returns:
ArrayList Array of of the tags associated with the picture

getPicsByTag

public java.util.ArrayList<Picture> getPicsByTag(java.lang.String tag)
getPicsByTag takes in a string value of the tag and searches the TAGTABLE and PICTURETABLE for unique picture IDs that have stored the tag. getPicsByTag returns an array list of picture objects.

Parameters:
tag - String value of the tag to search for
Returns:
pics ArrayList of pictures with the tag

cursorToPic

private java.util.ArrayList<Picture> cursorToPic(Cursor cursor)
cursorToPic takes in a cursor object and returns (for that cursor) an ArrayList of picture objects that from that cursor (for the getPicsByTag method call)

Parameters:
cursor - Cursor object corresponding to the getPicsByTag query
Returns:
pics ArrayList of pictures resulting from the query

getAllTags

public java.lang.String[] getAllTags()
getAllTags returns a string array of all tags stored in the TAGTABLE.

Returns:
tags Array of strings corresponding to all stored tags.

getPicsByDate

public java.util.ArrayList<Picture> getPicsByDate(long time,
                                                  java.lang.String when)
getPicsByDate takes in the value of time for which the user is querying for pictures from. Long value of time is the time in milliseconds and the string value of when corresponds to whether the user is searching "before or after". If 'when' is null, search for all pictures that were taken on the day specified by time. getPicsByDate returns an ArrayList pictures that correspond to the appropriate search by date.

Parameters:
time - Long value of the time in milliseconds
when - Specifies if the search should look before or after this time
Returns:
ArrayList Array list of pictures that meet the query specifications

getPicsByNote

public java.util.ArrayList<Picture> getPicsByNote(java.lang.String text)
getPicsByNote takes in a string value of the text to query for. getPicsByNote queries the PICTURETABLE and returns an array list of pictures which have stored the query text into their note column (from ImageActivity)

Parameters:
text - String value of the note we are searching for
Returns:
ArrayList ArrayList of picture objects from the search
